clusterList.phrase: dogs on the street pumas on your feet how cues in the environment influence product evaluation and choice
researchers have argued that consumer behavior is strongly influenced by subtle environmental cues
our results demonstrate that the prevalence of environmental cues as simple as color can affect product accessibility even in noisy real-world consumer environments
we theorized that this differential cueing by the environment would cause participants who were exposed to trays in their daily environment to consume more fruits and vegetables
although catchiness may indeed be important marketers should also pay greater attention to whether their slogans and products will be cued by the environment
our findings show that cue exposure can affect attitudes not only toward the exposed object but also toward any object that shares a conceptual relationship
conceptual priming effects can have a strong impact on real-world consumer judgments
an intelligent network of sensors tuned to give the homeowner a better understanding of the relationship between their lifestyle and their carbon imprint
